verses.esv:
24   Whoever spares the rod hates his son,
    but he who loves him is diligent to discipline him.
verses.kjv: 24 He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
verses.niv: 24 He who spares the rod hates his son, but he who loves him is careful to discipline him.

verses.esv:
15   The rod and reproof give wisdom,
    but a child left to himself brings shame to his mother.
verses.kjv: 15 The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
verses.niv: 15 The rod of correction imparts wisdom, but a child left to himself disgraces his mother.

verses.esv:
13   Do not withhold discipline from a child;
    if you strike him with a rod, he will not die.
14   If you strike him with the rod,
    you will save his soul from Sheol.
verses.kjv: 13 Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die. 14 Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
verses.niv: 13 Do not withhold discipline from a child; if you punish him with the rod, he will not die. 14 Punish him with the rod and save his soul from death.

verses.esv: 4 Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
verses.kjv: 4 And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.
verses.niv: 4 Fathers, do not exasperate your children; instead, bring them up in the training and instruction of the Lord.

verses.esv:
18   Discipline your son, for there is hope;
    do not set your heart on putting him to death.
verses.kjv: 18 Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
verses.niv: 18 Discipline your son, for in that there is hope; do not be a willing party to his death.

verses.esv:
17   Discipline your son, and he will give you rest;
    he will give delight to your heart.
verses.kjv: 17 Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
verses.niv: 17 Discipline your son, and he will give you peace; he will bring delight to your soul.

verses.esv: 11 For the moment all discipline seems painful rather than pleasant, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
verses.kjv: 11 Now no chastening for the present seemeth to be joyous, but grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceable fruit of righteousness unto them which are exercised thereby.
verses.niv: 11 No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.

verses.esv: 21 Fathers, do not provoke your children, lest they become discouraged.
verses.kjv: 21 Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.
verses.niv: 21 Fathers, do not embitter your children, or they will become discouraged.

verses.esv:
13   Do not withhold discipline from a child;
    if you strike him with a rod, he will not die.
verses.kjv: 13 Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
verses.niv: 13 Do not withhold discipline from a child; if you punish him with the rod, he will not die.

verses.esv:
15   Folly is bound up in the heart of a child,
    but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
verses.kjv: 15 Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
verses.niv: 15 Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline will drive it far from him.

verses.esv:
6   Train up a child in the way he should go;
    even when he is old he will not depart from it.
verses.kjv: 6 Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
verses.niv: 6 Train a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not turn from it.

verses.esv: 6:1 Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.
verses.kjv: 1 Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.
verses.niv: 1 Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.

verses.esv: 20 Children, obey your parents in everything, for this pleases the Lord.
verses.kjv: 20 Children, obey your parents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
verses.niv: 20 Children, obey your parents in everything, for this pleases the Lord.

verses.esv:
13:1   A wise son hears his father’s instruction,
    but a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
verses.kjv: 1 A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
verses.niv: 1 A wise son heeds his father's instruction, but a mocker does not listen to rebuke.

verses.esv:
6   For the Lord disciplines the one he loves,
    and chastises every son whom he receives.”

7 It is for discipline that you have to endure. God is treating you as sons. For what son is there whom his father does not discipline?
verses.kjv: 6 For whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth, and scourgeth every son whom he receiveth. 7 If ye endure chastening, God dealeth with you as with sons; for what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?
verses.niv: 6 because the Lord disciplines those he loves, and he punishes everyone he accepts as a son." 7 Endure hardship as discipline; God is treating you as sons. For what son is not disciplined by his father?

verses.esv: 19 Those whom I love, I reprove and discipline, so be zealous and repent.
verses.kjv: 19 As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.
verses.niv: 19 Those whom I love I rebuke and discipline. So be earnest, and repent.

verses.esv: 4 “Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one. 5 You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might. 6 And these words that I command you today shall be on your heart. 7 You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise. 8 You shall bind them as a sign on your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes. 9 You shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
verses.kjv: 4 Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God is one LORD: 5 And thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might. 6 And these words, which I command thee this day, shall be in thine heart: 7 And thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up. 8 And thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand, and they shall be as frontlets between thine eyes. 9 And thou shalt write them upon the posts of thy house, and on thy gates.
verses.niv: 4 Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one. 5 Love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength. 6 These commandments that I give you today are to be upon your hearts. 7 Impress them on your children. Talk about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up. 8 Tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads. 9 Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.

verses.esv:
30   Blows that wound cleanse away evil;
    strokes make clean the innermost parts.
verses.kjv: 30 The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
verses.niv: 30 Blows and wounds cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the inmost being.

verses.esv: 4 He must manage his own household well, with all dignity keeping his children submissive,
verses.kjv: 4 One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;
verses.niv: 4 He must manage his own family well and see that his children obey him with proper respect.

verses.esv:
14   If you strike him with the rod,
    you will save his soul from Sheol.
verses.kjv: 14 Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
verses.niv: 14 Punish him with the rod and save his soul from death.

verses.esv:
3   By the mouth of a fool comes a rod for his back,
    but the lips of the wise will preserve them.
verses.kjv: 3 In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
verses.niv: 3 A fool's talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.

verses.esv: 12 “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
verses.kjv: 12 Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
verses.niv: 12 "Honor your father and your mother, so that you may live long in the land the LORD your God is giving you.

verses.esv:
23   For the commandment is a lamp and the teaching a light,
    and the reproofs of discipline are the way of life,
verses.kjv: 23 For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
verses.niv: 23 For these commands are a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the corrections of discipline are the way to life,

verses.esv:
11   When a scoffer is punished, the simple becomes wise;
    when a wise man is instructed, he gains knowledge.
verses.kjv: 11 When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
verses.niv: 11 When a mocker is punished, the simple gain wisdom; when a wise man is instructed, he gets knowledge.

verses.esv: 11 Because the sentence against an evil deed is not executed speedily, the heart of the children of man is fully set to do evil.
verses.kjv: 11 Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.
verses.niv: 11 When the sentence for a crime is not quickly carried out, the hearts of the people are filled with schemes to do wrong.
